summary: Golf social dating app connecting single golfers through online profiles with handicap and social preferences (business, pleasure, casual, romantic). Features gender-based and couples searching, location-based map showing singles by proximity to golf courses, course booking integration, course directory, sponsors page, and event hosting.
architectural_notes: Social dating platform focused on golf community
Location-based services required for proximity matching
Integration with external golf course booking systems
User authentication and profile management system
Sign-up page required with comprehensive profile data collection
Profile photo upload and storage functionality needed
Course directory dynamically built from user-submitted home courses
Member profiles linked to courses for discovery and networking
Public course data (website, booking info) stored and displayed
known_issues: Post-login pages lack content and functional navigation

existing_features.title: Create location-based map view that displays online single golfers by their proximity to the user's location or specific golf course locations
Build main landing page with sign up button, log in button, and golf course background image as backdrop
Implement course booking search feature that allows users to search for golf course bookings and links to local booking sites or course websites
Create course directory page that lists golf courses with details and contact information
Build sponsors page to display sponsor information and branding
Create event host page where users can view and create golf events
Implement chat system that allows matched users to communicate with each other through real-time or async messaging
Design and apply a cohesive visual theme with golf-inspired colors (greens, earth tones), clean typography, and modern layout patterns that evoke sophistication and outdoor sporting elegance
Replace the golf ball icon in the header navigation with the Lime Greens™ brand logo
Update the landing page hero section to feature the Lime Greens™ brand logo prominently
Render the generated Lime Greens™ logo image as a static asset from frontend/public/assets/generated
Populate the MapView page with functional content showing matched golfer profiles in an interactive grid or map interface with filtering options for handicap range, distance, and social preference
Enhance the CourseDirectory page with functional search and filter controls for course name, location, and amenities
Add functional navigation buttons and content sections to the EventsPage including upcoming events list, past events archive, and RSVP functionality
Implement functional message composition and conversation management in the ChatPage with message history, typing indicators, and read status
Add functional sponsor cards to the SponsorsPage with clickable logos, descriptions, and external links to sponsor websites
Make all header navigation links and buttons functional across all authenticated pages with active state indicators
Enhance the CourseBooking page with functional search filters for date, time, number of players, and course location with real-time availability display
Add click handler to the Get Started button on the landing page that initiates Internet Identity authentication flow
Create a new SignUpPage component that users navigate to when clicking the Get Started button on the landing page
Add age input field to the sign-up form with numeric validation
Add handicap input field to the sign-up form with numeric validation for golf handicap range
Add gender selection field with options for male, female, or couple
Add seeking preference field with options for male, female, or couple to indicate what type of match the user is looking for
Add bio textarea field where users can describe their likes, dislikes, themselves, and their ideal golf partner
Add location input section to the sign-up form for capturing user's geographical location
Add home course input section to the sign-up form where users can specify their primary golf course
Add profile photo upload option to the sign-up form allowing users to upload an image file
Apply golf-themed styling to the sign-up page consistent with the existing visual design system using golf-inspired colors, typography, and layout patterns
Wire sign-up form submission to backend profile creation with validation and error handling
Update CourseDirectory page to display a list of members for each course, showing member avatars, names, and basic public information
Make member entries in the CourseDirectory clickable, navigating to a dedicated profile detail view page when a member is clicked
Display all public course information on the CourseDirectory page including course website URLs and booking links for each course
Create a new profile detail page component that displays a user's complete public profile including age, handicap, gender, preferences, bio, location, home course, and profile photo
Add a dropdown navigation menu in the left-hand corner of the header that displays links to all authenticated pages (Map View, Course Directory, Course Booking, Events, Chat, Sponsors, Profile)
Update the Layout component to integrate the dropdown navigation menu alongside the existing header navigation, ensuring both navigation patterns coexist without visual conflicts
Update the Get Started button on the LandingPage to navigate to the SignUpPage route (/sign-up) when clicked
Update the Sign In button on the LandingPage to trigger Internet Identity authentication flow and navigate authenticated users to the MapView page
Add a 'Message' button to each member profile card in the CourseDirectory page that initiates a new conversation with that member
Add a 'Message' button to the ProfileDetailPage that allows users to initiate a conversation with the profile owner
Add a 'Message' button to each match profile card in the MapView page that initiates a conversation with the matched user
Update ChatPage to automatically open or create a conversation when navigated to with a specific user Principal ID passed via route parameters or state

new_feature_requests.summary: User profiles with handicap and social preference fields
Search filters for gender matching and couples/twosome searches
Location-based map showing singles near golf courses
Main landing page with golf course backdrop, sign up and log in buttons
Course booking search integration with local booking sites
Course directory
Sponsors page
Event host page
Chat system for users to communicate
Create user profile system with fields for handicap (numeric), gender (male/female/couple), social preference (business/pleasure/casual/romantic), location (coordinates or address), and bio text
Implement search functionality that filters users by gender preference matching (male searching female, female searching male, couples searching other twosomes)
Add Lime Greens™ brand logo to the app
Add functional content and working buttons/navigation to all pages after user login

Create sign-up page with fields for age, handicap, gender (male/female/couple), seeking preference (male/female/couple), bio for likes/dislikes and ideal match, location, home course, and profile photo upload - all with golf theme
Update backend UserProfile type to include age field as Nat (natural number)
Update backend UserProfile type to include lookingFor field matching the Gender type (Male, Female, Couple)
Update backend UserProfile type to include homeCourse field as Text for storing user's primary golf course name
Update backend UserProfile type to include profilePhoto field as ?Blob for storing uploaded profile image data
Create backend function to save complete user profile including all new fields (age, lookingFor, homeCourse, profilePhoto) when sign-up form is submitted
Create dynamic course directory that auto-populates from user profiles and displays members by course with clickable profile access
Display public course information (website, booking links, etc.) on the course directory page
Add functionality to view individual member profiles by clicking on them from course member lists
Update backend Course type to include a members field that stores an array of Principal IDs representing users who have listed this course as their home course

Implement backend logic to automatically create or update course entries when a user specifies a home course during profile creation or update, adding the user's Principal to that course's members list
Create backend query function to retrieve course details including all member profiles for a specific course, returning public profile information for each member
Add a dropdown navigation menu in the left-hand corner that links to all pages/sites on the webpage
Make landing page buttons active links that navigate to the respective pages
Add user messaging functionality so course members can connect with each other
